page.title: 03BIOGRAPHY
page.content: When World War 1-1914-18- was being fought in Europe.The Rev. Studdart Kennedy better known as "Woodbine Willie" went around the battlefields comforting soldiers and giving them their last rites.He was the vicar at St.Pauls Church,Worcester he did his best to help others.He gave away Wood- bine cigarettes hence his nickname. Edward Elgar (later Sir Edward) was a great English composer a son of Worcester who was born near Worcester. His family had a music shop in the High St. Among his compositions the most famous is Land of Hope and Glory. Vesta Tilley was born in the Block- house area of Worcester.Her family was poor but she became a famous music hall artist performing in Worcester. She became a Lady and a benefactress. Some new flats in the Blockhouse are named Vesta Tilley Court after her.
